short_description: Experience the natural beauty and rich Polynesian culture of American Samoa, a U.S. territory in the South Pacific. Discover pristine beaches, lush rainforests, vibrant coral reefs, and the warm hospitality of the Samoan people.

health.tap_water_safety: Generally safe, but bottled water is recommended
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 21
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues and stores
Public consumption laws apply similar to U.S. regulations

tipping.hotels: Tipping is appreciated for porters and housekeeping, similar to U.S. customs
tipping.guides: 10-15% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 15-20% tip is customary for good service
tipping.taxis: Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory

weather.title: American Samoa has a tropical rainforest climate with warm temperatures year-round, high humidity, and significant rainfall. The wet season runs from November to April, while the dry season is from May to October.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Less rainfall and slightly cooler temperatures make this the best time to visit. Perfect for beach activities, hiking, and outdoor adventures. Ideal conditions for diving and snorkeling

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Warmer temperatures with higher humidity and more frequent rain showers. Still enjoyable for travel, with lush green landscapes. Be prepared for tropical downpours

when_to_visit.title: Whale Watching
when_to_visit.short_description: Humpback whales migrate through the waters during this period, making it an excellent time for whale watching tours and marine wildlife encounters

weather.best_time: The best time to visit American Samoa is during the dry season from May to October when rainfall is lower and temperatures are slightly more comfortable, making it ideal for beach activities, hiking, and water sports
